website_summaries.verdict: Despite being a bit underpowered, it's worth considering if you want an easy-to-use edger to give a neat look along sidewalks and landscaping in your yard.
pros: Features a compact build and straightforward operation that make it easy for most users to operate
Height adjustment offers 6 positions for various edging jobs
cons: Not as powerful as other options on our list, but it's suitable for small yards with minimal edging needs
Doesn't always start on the first try

website_summaries.verdict: A well-built machine capable of creating clean, manicured results. A great choice for big jobs.
pros: Sturdy build and powerful, maneuverable design
132cc gas-powered engine is great for larger yards

website_summaries.verdict: Simplicity is the hallmark of this model, for people who want a no-fuss edger that provides a clean, even cut.
pros: Jump-start technology is the primary benefit of this model, which is easy to use and requires no mixing of gas and oil to run
Handle is cushioned to avoid strain on hands
Handle-mounted throttle makes for an easy transition from cutting to idling
3 transport wheels offer stability so cuts stay even
cons: Less powerful than some models, it may not work as well on areas of thick growth

customer_reviews.title: I really do not understand the bad reviews of this device
customer_reviews.text: I really do not understand the bad reviews of this device. My only complaint is that it doesn't do the work for me automatically. Seriously people, what are you trying to cut? Yeah the blades spin backwards. So what. It works without issue and has cut my edging time by over half. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it supposed to do, but temperamental.
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is supposed to do but is temperamental and does not work well with much resistance. This is probably expected for the price paid. I used to edge my driveway and walkway with a weed-eater edging attachment until the weed-eater died. This was a replacement and does not work as well as my previous equipment. After running for a while and turning off, it will not run at full throttle for about 5-10 minutes after restarting and acts like it is flooded. The oil compartment is poorly designed (on the side and opens horizontally) and does not have a dipstick. It is very difficult to tell the oil level.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this edger last year and used it about 8 times last fall and this summer. Rope pull broke and wouldn't work anymore. I took it in to a Troy-built warranty center and after about 3 weeks, they fixed it on warranty. The dogs on the flywheel broke off. I got it back and used it 3 times and the same problem occurred. I took it back and they contacted MTD, the manufacturer of Troy-built and they said that I am pulling too hard and they would not cover it anymore. I have had dozens of lawn products and have not had any break like this. This is a very fragile product and I would stay away from it!
customer_reviews.author: underpar21

customer_reviews.title: Meh"
customer_reviews.text: It does not work well on Florida's thick floritam type grasses. It's a bit wimpy. The wire standoff gauge and the plastic blade guard are classic garbage. the little 29cc engine has a tough time of it although it runs very but people with southern heat resistant thick widebladed grass should at a very minimum purchase one with a bigger engine. The price is somewhat realistic for what you get, but I think it will work better on northern rye blends much better. Overall not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a toy!
customer_reviews.text: This edger is an expensive toy. It doesn't have enough power to do even the most simple edging job. Unfortunately it was one of those items that Amazon won't let you return. I didn't find that out until I attempted to return it and found it had to be returned directly to the seller. It cost me a bundle to return it but there was nothing at my house that I could use it for. Getting half my money back was better that having it just sit in my garage...and I don't need an expensive toy taking up room in my garage. I would NOT recommend it to anyone...even for the smallest edging job.
customer_reviews.author: Tigger

customer_reviews.title: This is a poor quality. I should have listened to the reviews
customer_reviews.text: This is a poor quality. I should have listened to the reviews. it only cuts good in reverse and stalls often.
customer_reviews.author: Suzyp

customer_reviews.title: Easy start but bogs down often
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful. Easy start but bogs down often. Honestly it edges better when pulled backwards that when pushed. Extremely disappointed in this toro product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Not robust
customer_reviews.text: Have had it a couple seasons now. Wore out the plastic pulley on the very first usage (melted) and chalked that one up to me. So naught a replacement pulley and rebuilt it. Used it a couple times season 2 trying to baby it and made it through that season, but had to go very slow. Season 3, melted the pulley again even trying to baby it. I dont use it regularly, which may lead to the problem. Will look for a bigger edger, which is a shame as I only have a single driveway to edge.
customer_reviews.author: William Chastain

customer_reviews.title: No machine after machine in shop under warranty BAD UNIT DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Broke in less then a year brought warranty. Warranty said still on manufacturing warranty send to repair shop three months later no Edger had replacement unit stop working two months do not buy please . Now 2019 still having problem 3 years of problem not a good product Amazon should not sell this unit. Had to pay $30 to get my unit back not working. Company does not cover Carburetor unit under warranty, junk please do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Antonio E

customer_reviews.title: Troy-Bilt edger review
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough for big and well established lawns. Adjustment highs and lows for blade hard to change. Light weight and easy to handle. This product would be great for small yards.
customer_reviews.author: Derryal R. Strickland

customer_reviews.title: Very particular about his tools kinda guy!
customer_reviews.text: Very particular about his tools kinda guy! Husband loves it! Well thought out overall design and smooth running motor, easy handling plus nicely adjustable for tall person. Only draw back.. he's hoping a wider blade is available for greater definition between grass edge and sidewalk/patio.
customer_reviews.author: SBwell

customer_reviews.title: Quit Working After Two Uses, Disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked twice now won't stay running. It was great when it worked. Now, it takes forever to start, I even bought a jump starter (which is basically a drill with allen-wrench on end, could have saved my money.) . IF it does start, it dies within 30 seconds. Tired of messing with it and don't want to spend more money on a defective product. Waste of money for sure.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Did not last
customer_reviews.text: Bought this about 1 1/2 years ago. cannot recommend it. Worked ok edging drive and sidewalks, tho somewhat underpowered. Recently, carburetor bulb failed. Tried two different new carbs from Amazon. Engine would idle but would not power up. Noticed significant oil build up at intake/air filter. Had enough, disposed of unit purchased a conventional Briggs & Stratton powered edger(more expensive of course), so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: C.A. O.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. I have a small lot and it works awesome. Pretty powerful and very easy to start. Usually 3-4 pulls. Works well for cutting new edges of maintaining existing ones. Can’t go wrong with this, especially considering how pricey many of the alternatives are. Takes some getting used to, to operate this well, but once you get the hang of it, great machine!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Balvanz

customer_reviews.title: This has exceeded our expectations. I ordered this for ...
customer_reviews.text: This has exceeded our expectations. I ordered this for my husband who was a critic of most edgers. This has exceeded his expectations. He gets the edging done in a short time.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Like it
customer_reviews.text: Kind of low power I do like the easy start, but the choke is make for perhaps small asian hands, it is a pain for me to adjust Overall satisfied with one summers use Works better backward cutting than forward, like most edgers
customer_reviews.author: mdocdoc

customer_reviews.title: The blade shown in the instructions and online is wide ...
customer_reviews.text: The blade shown in the instructions and online is wide one with teeth. The blade included is flat and appears to be made for edging sidewalks. Given the flat blade offers less resistance than the wider one, not included, I would have assumed it would work well. We used it in soft soil that had been rained on earlier in the day. At maximum depth the blade stopped repeatedly. The engine just did not have the power needed to push the flat blade through soft dirt. Hard to believe it could power the wider blade with teeth shown in the illustration.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Fagin

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on hard soil
customer_reviews.text: This product did not work at all. We do have harder soil but I spent more because of that. I didn't even make a dent. It was not easy to get my money back because it's a gas product but I managed.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Needs some work..
customer_reviews.text: It works ok,but could use some work with the string starter. Also it could use some more power. I purchased the optional auto starter and that makes it a lot easier to start.
customer_reviews.author: Elrief1

customer_reviews.title: Disppointing
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this product. Although lacking power and torque, it still did a reasonable job edging for a short while. Now, after being used only a few times, it refuses to start. I’m suspecting a faulty carburetor. I’m not even sure that it’s worth fixing. I wish I had never bought this.
customer_reviews.author: jbrown157

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and set up and started right up
customer_reviews.text: This edger is just the right size for the size of my lawn. I found it easy to set up. I have lots of power and hand tools but I didn't need any of them to assemble or set up the edger. I've only used it once so far but it worked fine. Although it has a primer bulb, I also used the choke and it started right up. I just wish the choke lever was easier to access.
customer_reviews.author: mailpup

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Quit working the second time I used it. The blade would quit running as soon as it would touch the ground.
customer_reviews.author: want 2

customer_reviews.title: If you're looking for something to take up space in the shed. Buy it
customer_reviews.text: After 3 months of use now it won't start. Wish there was a zero star review. Headed to the corner of shame in the shed. Troy-Bilt used to be so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Looks like i'll have to return it for one that will
customer_reviews.text: I cannot get it to start.Looks like i'll have to return it for one that will.Called troybilt they didn't have any answers. Any advice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is like a toy.  not sure why I purchased this.
customer_reviews.text: Much to light. Adjusting the blade is ridiculous and does not work; Positioning of oil filler and gas tank poor. Overall very poor. Powerless motor such that the device stalls when trying to realy edge. Maybe works for dichondra but not "real" lawns. Overall design and functionality very poor
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Good Trimmer, Mine was missing one of the knobs for the handle. Not worth the trouble of sending back, but I did knock off a star.
customer_reviews.author: Mark S.

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 1st use and warranty repair denied
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, the plastic pulley that moves the blade melted to the belt. I only made it 2/3 of the way around my driveway. I have edged this area for 2 years, so the edger was not cutting through a never edged area. I took it to a Troy Bilt repair center and MTD refused to cover it under warranty. On top of that, the shop charged me a $50 evaluation fee. I tried to return it to Amazon and they will not take it back. Stay away from Troy Bilt, they have really gone downhill.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time
customer_reviews.text: This machine worked great when I first got it, but 6 months later it is almost impossible to start. Warranty is expired. Would not recommend to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Doesn't make much of a difference. My weed whacker was cheaper and does a better job.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Jump Starting
customer_reviews.text: The very first start didn’t work by pulling the rope. I connected the jumper to my drill and it started right up. Pulling the starter rope worked from then on.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the ease of operation, great cutting job, lighter weight than usual edgers, makes the edging on the yard much easier
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Man

customer_reviews.title: don't buy it for a gift
customer_reviews.text: not impressed should have returned it. My husband uses the weed Wacker instead, very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: i1der2

customer_reviews.title: Once edge is there it works fine. The only gripe is the blade turns backwards
customer_reviews.text: Once edge is there it works fine. The only gripe is the blade turns backwards. Kicks mud on stuff in front of it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: More power
customer_reviews.text: Needs more power but it works just have to go slow not like my weed eater.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate. Not good for long grass, or tough grass. Does not clear the debris.
customer_reviews.author: Leon K.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: This edger is nice, because you don't have to have an extension chord to use it. I wish the final edging job was a bit more defined and neat, but...all in all...a decent machine.
customer_reviews.author: RJD

customer_reviews.title: Works great as long as it isn't wet
customer_reviews.text: Edger works amazing. I used it on my driveway that was pretty bad. When the dirt was wet, it clumped up and didn't work very well. I waited until it dried out and had zero issue. It made my driveway look great. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Curry

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk! Does not even start out of box. Why would anyone sell a product like this? Called their technical support. No help at all. Terrible!
customer_reviews.author: yingmei cheng

customer_reviews.title: Should work more than 2 seasons
customer_reviews.text: Never started up as easily as advertised, and now at less than 2 years old, (maybe used 25ish Times) it shut off while I was using it and won’t restart.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Stopped running within a few weeks of purchase
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for edging my free form borderless lawn. Light too.
customer_reviews.author: Bonny B.

customer_reviews.title: Cowl needs to be reengineered.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly pleased with the whole unit. It is definitely not for commercial use. Blade cowl keeps one from pushing the unit. It digs into the grass. Works better if ya pull it, yet obviously not has safe. Starts pretty good, runs quite.
customer_reviews.author: Paul 1950

customer_reviews.title: Broke 2nd use- seller doesnt respond
customer_reviews.text: Broke on 2nd use. Contacted seller with no response. Brought to get repaired, repair shop said it would cost more to repair than item was worth. After just 2 uses it was nothing but some metal and plastic to me, with no assistance from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy start NOT included.
customer_reviews.text: Beware the easy start is NOT included. The pictures and add are a bit misleading. I bought this for a female and got this one because it appeared the easy start tool was included. Nice machine overall though.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore M.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job but for larger areas it is a little undersized.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to edge my yard every two weeks. Nice surprise is that I've used it five times and it started up all five times. The key is to play with the throttle sometimes. Sometimes not at all but once it starts up it runs fine Cuts well.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Sowards

customer_reviews.title: A Win!
customer_reviews.text: This guy is tough. Years of unkept lawn/patio/sidewalk. I thought it'd be tough and we'd need to do it three or four times. Went through the overgrown mess like it was nothing. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Songbird

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, cheap plastic junk!
customer_reviews.text: Used this edger for less than a half hour the day I got it and the cost to replace the junk parts that melted were almost half the cost of the entire machine! Poor quality, cheap plastic junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: The edger is very light weight and easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: The edger is very light weight and easy to maneuver.. My biggest disappointment is the lack of curb edging capability.. I had thought that the adjustable wheel was for that purpose but it is not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: weak
customer_reviews.text: blade stopped spinning after an hours use...........that's after following the directions of multi depth cuts deep deeper etc
customer_reviews.author: stevie cole

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this edger. Waste of $$.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your $$ on this edger. Piece of junk. Can’t believe Troy Built put their name on it and that Amazon sells it. Hard to crank and under powered.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Corbett

customer_reviews.title: It gets the job done, not as rock solid ...
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done, not as rock solid or powerful as my neighbors $400 edger. Price was a major factor for me buying this over others. Odd feature is that the top of the blade rotates back and throws forward
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Works great. The only thing I would recommend is to ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. The only thing I would recommend is to purchase the 3 edge blade. Does a much better job.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Ballard

customer_reviews.title: Good for home use only.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well priced product if you want a nice edge in your lawn. However the blade spins counter clockwise and if you haven't edged in a long time, it lacks power if there is thick soil to cut through. It is nice that it takes strait gasoline.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Novak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This little edger works great for a homeowner who has a small number of plant beds to edge.
customer_reviews.author: Alfred L. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to operate. Don't like where the opening is to put oil.
customer_reviews.author: Ray S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: My husband hasn't used it much yet, but it works great so far.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: useless.
customer_reviews.text: Engine will not maintain rpm..there is no adjustment of the carb other than idle speed..as soon as you attempt to make a cut it bogs down and quits..useless.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and operate
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and operate. Starts very quickly. I will try a different blade to improve the finished results.
customer_reviews.author: James Harris

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very lite weight, so much so that it does not cut grass/sod. Will be selling at garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: looks just like pictures. runs nice and does a good job
customer_reviews.author: Wmc1017

customer_reviews.title: Was unable to review because it had no blade.
customer_reviews.text: It came with no blade. I found it. Sorry about that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The troy-bilt edger is one great by it work very good.
customer_reviews.author: clemmon stewart

customer_reviews.title: Starts with ease.  Edging nor too good.
customer_reviews.text: Does not cutclean, soil clups up don't like it and wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: rene carpentier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Starts easily and does exactly what it is designed to do. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: Very Nice Edger!! 4-Cycle Engine Is MUCH Smoother & Quieter Than 2-Cycle Models. Good Value Per Dollar!!
customer_reviews.author: Whit Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: It cranked and ran for 5 mins engine died and won't crank and hasn't cranked since.
customer_reviews.text: Since it can't be returned because of gas and oil being added I now on a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Terry  L Spann

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: hasnt worked since i bought it, oil plug is stripped.
customer_reviews.author: greg

customer_reviews.title: It is a good, light duty edger
customer_reviews.text: The product was delivered as ordered. It is a good, light duty edger.
customer_reviews.author: CF

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied so far
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied so far. Still getting used to it so can say for now it's better than I expected! Very well built and was easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good deal / I like that the cutting blade is ...
customer_reviews.text: good deal / I like that the cutting blade is on the right side / great idea for starting with the optional drill powered unit
customer_reviews.author: Leonard C.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this edger! Powerful and does a great job on my corner lot!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Used it one season, now won't start or fire ...
customer_reviews.text: Used it one season, now won't start or fire. Looking replacement sparkplug, not available locally. Can't find on line either.
customer_reviews.author: Andy H. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good. Works very good and makes my yard look great.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandra S.

customer_reviews.title: Worth The Money
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. Worth the money. Does many things. Came packaged well in a timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Not a good edger
customer_reviews.text: It does not edge well at all the engine is to small and will not spin the blade fast enough to leave a clean cut edge. Also if you try to use it in your yard the tires and wheels are to small and it just won't roll on the grass. It will work you to death trying to push it around your flower beds in the yard. I guess I will just have to try and give it away because I have no use for it.
customer_reviews.author: Litenin

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: love the easy use and how quick to start it with my drill
customer_reviews.author: Juan V.

customer_reviews.title: Following the instructions
customer_reviews.text: It took awhile to learn how it works. Once there it works great
customer_reviews.author: Rick Tritthart

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works wonderful for those hard to get crabgrass along the edge
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Payton

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: A little more power would be good,but this does a fine job ,is lightweight enough for my wife to use and is a good value
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: will work fine for my son in law. Its perfect for him
customer_reviews.author: William Miller

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the average home owner like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A Fagarasd

customer_reviews.title: Bad belt on new edger.
customer_reviews.text: Not so happy with the parts quality used in the build of this edger. In the first 5 minutes of use with this edger, the blade stopped rotating. Opening and inspecting the belt revealed 'no belt'...only small bits of rubber and string remain. See attached photo.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Grubbs

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: works ok - could not find replacement blade like the one on shipped machine. Gas tank is small and requires refill, have 400+' of edging. I like being able to control speed of blade.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Starts easily
customer_reviews.text: Troy Built products are good products with good engineering designs. The only products that I will ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Holderman

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the jump-start feature and the way blades stop when trigger-handle is not engaged.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Product works great, easy start and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Product works great,easy start and easy to use.love it,now just waiting on my lawn to grow this season so i can put it back to work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tales Some Getting Used Too
customer_reviews.text: This works well but takes a little practice to get used to using it. The reviews I read before purchasing were right in that the very first time you edge your lawn or garden you may need to go over it several times before the desired depth is reached. Only used it one day so far but it seems to work well at this point.
customer_reviews.author: brussell66

customer_reviews.title: Small but adequate.
customer_reviews.text: Adequate but a tad too light for what I'm used to using.
customer_reviews.author: Clarence Edward Trant

customer_reviews.title: The edger starts easily, and the engine runs smooth
customer_reviews.text: The edger starts easily, and the engine runs smooth, the problem is the blade runs counter-clockwise... Which means in order to get a good edge you have to walk backwards with the thing...
customer_reviews.author: Jeb Collins

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: this edger is terrible I thought for the cost it would be a good one when the blade touches the ground it stops moving. Now the blade doesn’t work at all. Garbage
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: For those of us who can no longer keep yanking a starter rope or no longer can lug around a battery operated edger/trimmer this edger with a JumpStart feature is an excellent product. All I did was prime the edger ten times per the instructions and then slipped in the JumpStart accessory. In a few seconds the edger was purring like a kitten. JumpStart is the greatest invention since sliced bread.
customer_reviews.author: Duffer.Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: must go back and forth to get a good cut. somewhat easy to start. collects mud buildup.
customer_reviews.author: matt coles

customer_reviews.title: Broke in one use
customer_reviews.text: Not only would the unit bog down as soon as it came in contact with grass roots, the breather cover and everything behind it popped off. After that the pull cord has no tension and won't turn the motor over. Wish I had read the no return policy before purchasing. I have had other Troy-Bilt tools but this item does not live up to their reputation.
customer_reviews.author: homeowner

customer_reviews.title: it is a fair little unit that just needs a couple of little fix's to make it a Great Little Unit
customer_reviews.text: It does not seem to have enough RPM"s, I don't think that it edges as well as others because it lags RPM, it is also very hard to steer straight because of the front wheel design which I WILL alter at a later date..... I will also work on it to try and get some more RPM's out of it!! But for the Money!!,,, it is a fair little unit that just needs a couple of little fix's to make it a Great Little Unit!! It would NOT be a good unit for Commercial work.... Would I buy another one????? For the first timers and Price, I defiantly would consider it for sure.. It's a Troy-Bilt Gear Head Jon
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: it is doing a good job, the only problem it is the reverse ...
customer_reviews.text: it is doing a good job, the only problem it is the reverse of what Iam used to, but it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce smith

customer_reviews.title: Great edger
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and use. Very happy with this purchase. Have a large corner lot and grass was overgrown onto the sidewalks. Was able to start with a shallow edge for first pass, changed setting and deepened and cleared all with just two passes.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: just about 5 months to the day, the cord doesn't catch the wheel to start the engine. obviously not a mechanic, so pardon the lack of proper terms. very, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: scootz

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this edger if you are looking for a serious edger. I purchased this because I wanted a 4 cycle gasoline engine and have had good experiences in the past. This unit was fast to put together, and basically unusable -- it chokes out a ridiculous number of times, possibly because of the blade direction. Whatever, Amazon should not have this type of poor item on its website. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: edger
customer_reviews.text: easy to assemble and started right out of the box used with intelligence for easy edging and trimming makes a handle tool for the yard and garden light weigh and easy starting make it very manueverable and easy to operate
customer_reviews.author: kennyj

product_meta.title: Troy-Bilt TB516 EC 29cc 4-Cycle Wheeled Edger with JumpStart Technology
product_meta.description: Give your yard a manicured look from edge to edge with the Troy-Bilt TB516 EC Wheeled Edger. The light-weight and maneuverable Troy-Bilt Wheeled Edger is perfect for cutting a clean edge along driveways, walks, and even garden beds. Featuring a 29cc 4-cycle engine, the Wheeled Edger has a heavy-duty 9-inch dual-tipped steel blade that cuts a clean edge along any pathway and provides an edging depth up to 1.75 inches. The Edger can be adjusted into 6 different height positions, providing a 2.5-inch cutting depth. Designed with 3 premium transport wheels to give the user stability and control while operating. The fully molded ergonomic handle design with handle mounted throttle and idle controls for easy operation. The TB516 EC is equipped with SpringAssist Technology to give you an easy start with a smooth steady pull. Eliminate pull starts with the JumpStart engine started (engine starter sold separately). Backed by a 2-year limited warranty, the Troy-Bilt TB516 EC Wheeled Edger gives you the perfect manicured lawn.
feature_bullets: The TB516 EC 29cc 4-cycle premium engine requires no mixing gas and oil
Equipped with Spring Assist Starting Techology, JumpStart capable, provides an easy start with just a smooth and steady pull
The heavy-duty 9-inch dual-tipped steel blade cuts a clean edge along driveways and sidewalks, edging with a 1.75-inch max depth
A fully-molded foldable ergonomic handle design with a handle mounted throttle and idle controls makes for smooth operation, and easy storage
3 premium transport wheels for added stability and control
